displayed_text: Patient: - going down and coming back, and, uh, my daughter said you don’t seem like you feel anything. I said, no, I feel pretty good there. And, uh, so I do have those particular days, but then I have those days as well. I said, oh, man, when this day going to be over with so I can go to bed tonight Doctor: Is that because of pain that those days are hard for you? Patient: Sometimes it’s, it’s pain, but a lot of the areas that I wasn’t haven’t pain in, uh, not much anymore. My heel on my left side was having a lot of pain that I think I had shared, and, uh, I still have some if I go and overdo it, but other than that, no, my shoulders every now and then. My biggest challenge now is, is getting a good night’s sleep. Doctor: Okay. Patient: And that’s because I’ve tried a number of different ways on how to sleep in the bed. I, I have these pillows that I prop up with a long pillow there, to try to lean up against the back of it so, I, you know, my back is up against the pillow. It works some nights. Some nights it doesn’t work. Doctor: Okay. And so you’re having trouble falling asleep or is it that you fall asleep and then you, you’re waking up with-? Patient: Well, I wake back up. And sometimes if, uh, you know how you try to get in a comfortable position? It’s trying to find that comfortable position for that night. Doctor: So you’re waking up because of pain? Patient: Uh, not pain all the time. Sometimes it’s just, uh, what’s the term I’m looking for? Doctor: Discomfort? Patient: Yeah. You know? And, uh, just trying to get in a place where you feel like this is where I need to be at, I’m happy here. So, uh, uh, one of the best sleeping place, and I hate to say it, is my living room downstairs on the couch. I prop the pillows up, and, uh, and got my favorite space, so when I lay down and put my back up right up against the back of it, but I don’t want to be in the business of sleeping on my living room couch every night, either. We have a sleep number bed that we purchased just for this, but, uh, uh, I wouldn’t recommend sleep number being if that’s what you’re going, you’re going to use it for, because it’s not all it’s, it’s cut out to be. You’re paying a lot of money for a bed. And sometimes it works, sometimes it don’t. So my biggest challenge each night is to figure out, okay, what’s going to work tonight? Is my Lazy Boy going to work? Uh, I even tried the floor with my granddaughter’s, uh, what do you call those things she has? Family Member: The bean bag. Patient: The bean bags. That was the worst idea I ever had. When I got in that bean bag, uh, I, I was in pain. And the bad part is I couldn’t get back out of the, get out of the bean bag, and get off the floor.

Patient: And there’s something else that my mom gave me, it’s just like a flavoring of a, you know? Doctor: Okay. So you’re, you’re doing what you can. Patient: Yeah. Yeah. Doctor: Okay. Let’s get M___. Okay. Yeah. (Door opening) Patient: I’ve been taking my uh you know the Calcitrate. That doesn’t sit well with me. Doctor: Yeah. Why don’t you give it a break? I mean you’ve been on it a while. Let’s give it a break. Patient: Because I, I know what to use it. The one I’ve got is four pills two times twice a day. And when I take the ones at night, man they just. Doctor: It just sits there. Patient: It just sits there. Doctor: Yeah. Just take the morning if you want. Patient: Okay. Doctor: Okay? Patient: Alright.

Patient: Let me say this here, Doc. Let me say this here. Everything that you tell me and you do – Doctor: Mm,hmm. Patient: she goes and she looks up everything Doctor: Perfect. Yes. Patient: You know I’m just surrounded with just good people taking good care. Doctor: People who care. Here’s what I said about the bike trip. It’s up to him really to be smart about it. You know I know he loves it and this is something he just has to work out by himself and also with you guys. There’s no real medical reason technically and it’s gonna take us a week or two to get that medicine, so there’s time. He says he’s not gonna stay down in F____. Family Member: It’s just what bothers me about it is the pain that sometimes he go through. Doctor: Yeah. Family Member: Sometimes the pain can be a ten and then sometimes the pain can be a four. Doctor: Yeah. Family Member: If he had a four, I’d be comfortable with him being on the bike – Doctor: Yeah, I know.

Family Member: If he overdoes it on one day. Doctor: Oh, of course. Oh, everybody does that. Patient: Okay. Doctor: Everybody does that not just you. Patient: Okay. Doctor: You know there’s two philosophies with that which is like oh, if it’s good day I’m gonna max it out so I can veg out the next day and I have some other patients that will just like pace themselves like I know it’s a good day but I don’t want to pay the price the next day so I’ll just moderate myself and then it’s more even. So, it’s really your preference. Some people would just be like I’d rather have one good day out of three rather than my the eh days. Patient: Right, okay. Doctor: So, a lot of people are different in their activity level. You know, some folks are just go, go, go, and some are like Patient: RIght. Doctor: oh, no, I like to chill and be on my computer and watch my TV and get on the phone, you know, so everyone’s activity level. Patient: I like more activity. Doctor: Yeah.
